units.unit_name: Unit 1: How are light and heat explained?

areas_of_study.area_name: How are light and heat explained?
areas_of_study.area_description: In this area of study, students explore the fundamental physics concepts of light and thermal energy.

outcomes.outcome_name: Model, investigate, and evaluate the wave-like nature of light and thermal energy.
outcomes.outcome_description: On completion of this unit the student should be able to model, investigate and evaluate the wave-like nature of light, thermal energy and the emission and absorption of light by matter.

sub_topics.sub_topic_name: Identify all electromagnetic waves as transverse waves
sub_topics.details: Identify all electromagnetic waves as transverse waves travelling at the same speed, c, in a vacuum as distinct from mechanical waves that require a medium to propagate.

sub_topics.sub_topic_name: Identify the amplitude, wavelength, period and frequency of waves
sub_topics.details: Identify the amplitude, wavelength, period and frequency of waves.
